comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: The prisoners are barefoot, and a mixture of very old and very young. It looks like the Serbs were nearly depleted of regular soldiers by this point.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: LoC has another copy of this picture at www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2009631748/ Summary: Print shows a large group of Serbian soldiers, most are barefoot, captured at Kreka.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The LoC's other photo has the full caption "Comitadjis serbes faits prisonniers à Kreka près Touzla" (Komitadji Serbs taken prisoner at Kreka near Tuzla). The Komitadjis were guerrilla fighters who fought the Turks in Macedonia and other rivals. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Komitadji Tuzla is in Bosnia/Herzogovina, then a part of Austro-Hungary.
